key_points: Halyna Hutchins, a director of photography, died after Alec Baldwin discharged a prop gun on the set of 'Rust'.
The film's director, Joel Souza, was also injured during the incident.
Prop master Joseph Fisher highlighted the extreme safety measures taken with weapons on set.
A variety of 'prop guns' are used in TV and film, ranging from completely fake to actual working guns that fire blanks.
Blank firing can still be dangerous due to projectiles such as gun powder and gas.
The use of blanks aims to contribute to the authenticity of scenes, despite the potential risks.
Blanks expel gunpowder and hot gases, which can be harmful at close range.
Former police chief Daniel Oates emphasized the importance of treating every gun as if it's loaded and dangerous.
The Santa Fe County Sheriff's Office stated the investigation into the incident is 'open and active' with no charges filed yet.
The use of prop guns and blanks on film sets is common but not without risks.
spokespersons: Dave Brown (Professional firearms instructor, Firearms safety coordinator)
Daniel Oates (Former police chief, Miami Beach, Florida, and Aurora, Colorado)
